title: Initiating spygate, loading heat onto New Zealand while relieving pressure on England...it was Eddie Jones at his mischievous best
text:
As soon as we heard that Eddie Jones wanted to speak five days before the New Zealand game, we knew fireworks were coming. And England’s coach came with a flame, setting off a spying row and declaring that "pressure is chasing them [the All Blacks] down the street."

This was a bravura performance by Jones, who is looking for edges against the world champions in Saturday’s semi-final. The tactic of claiming all the pressure is on the opposition is straight from chapter one of the coaching mind games manual. But rarely is it backed up with so much mischief and wit. The one downside might...
description: As soon as we heard that Eddie Jones wanted to speak five days before the New Zealand game, we knew fireworks were coming.
